posts.post_content: A decent way to spend vast amounts of mana in mono-green decks. Plus, it makes wurms, and wurms are awesome.
posts.html:
A decent way to spend vast amounts of mana in mono-green decks. Plus, it makes wurms, and wurms are awesome.

Rating:

posts.post_content: Interestingly enough, in an EDH game I realized that, with [Fecundity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fecundity) on the battlefield this card also gains what I like to call cycling buyback for {2}{G}{G} (cast Wurmcalling for {G} with buyback cost of {2}{G}, the 0/0 wurm token enters the battlefield and then goes to graveyard, allowing you to draw a card)
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Almost strictly better than, say, [Ivy Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ivy Elemental); people are used to things like [Feral Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Feral Hydra) or [Protean Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Protean Hydra), though, so this seems a bit vanilla in comparison. Still a nice card, though.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: With [Essence of the Wild](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Essence of the Wild) out, you can repeatably make 6/6s for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol). Note that these will stay copies of EotW even if the original is killed, but will enter as 0/0s if your only EotW is killed in response. [Sprout Swarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sprout Swarm), on the other hand, makes them for 5 with convoke at instant speed.
posts.html:
With Essence of the Wild out, you can repeatably make 6/6s for . Note that these will stay copies of EotW even if the original is killed, but will enter as 0/0s if your only EotW is killed in response. Sprout Swarm, on the other hand, makes them for 5 with convoke at instant speed.

Posted By: kiseki (3/19/2012 4:50:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
2GG + X for an X/X every turn is fairly friggin solid in mono green.  
  
With a half decent hand in a deck built for effects like this you can be cranking out at least a 4/4 every turn starting on turn 3.   
  
Most of the time though, I'd prefer to draw this turn 5+. Works wicked with [Garruk's Packleader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk's Packleader) though. That has won me more than a few counter-top games.
posts.html:
2GG + X for an X/X every turn is fairly friggin solid in mono green.

With a half decent hand in a deck built for effects like this you can be cranking out at least a 4/4 every turn starting on turn 3.

Most of the time though, I'd prefer to draw this turn 5+. Works wicked with Garruk's Packleader though. That has won me more than a few counter-top games.

Posted By: dberry02 (12/19/2011 11:14:29 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: [Sprout Swarm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sprout Swarm) is a better card because it's an instant and lets you cheat on mana with convoke, but, this can make bigger tokens then just 1/1s which can allows you to trade up with bigger creatures more efficiently then something like sprout swarm. Also very good with populate. That being said your not going to play this in a deck that can't produce a lot of mana efficiently. ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Variable Colorless](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=X&type=symbol) is really expensive in most standard 60 card decks and casting this without buyback is actively painful. Seems good in EDH though like with your general as [Trostani, Selesnya's Voice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trostani, Selesnya's Voice) or [Wort, the Raidmother](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wort, the Raidmother).
posts.html:
Sprout Swarm is a better card because it's an instant and lets you cheat on mana with convoke, but, this can make bigger tokens then just 1/1s which can allows you to trade up with bigger creatures more efficiently then something like sprout swarm. Also very good with populate. That being said your not going to play this in a deck that can't produce a lot of mana efficiently. is really expensive in most standard 60 card decks and casting this without buyback is actively painful. Seems good in EDH though like with your general as Trostani, Selesnya's Voice or Wort, the Raidmother.

Posted By: Hercynian (2/2/2013 7:53:56 PM)

posts.post_content:
This creates a lot of inevitability in EDH decks that are G, X/G, or X/X/G.   
  
Even if you've run out of gas completely and are pretty much in topdeck mode with no real way to recharge, having this in hand means you can tap out for a wurm each turn that's got power and toughness equal to the number of lands/manarocks you have minus 4. When EDH games run long, you can be dropping a 10/10 wurm every turn at least. Even without trample or other forms of evasion, that many beaters is still a formidable force.  
  
Converts late-game outta-gas mode into endless wurm creation? Sign me up.
posts.html:
This creates a lot of inevitability in EDH decks that are G, X/G, or X/X/G.

Even if you've run out of gas completely and are pretty much in topdeck mode with no real way to recharge, having this in hand means you can tap out for a wurm each turn that's got power and toughness equal to the number of lands/manarocks you have minus 4. When EDH games run long, you can be dropping a 10/10 wurm every turn at least. Even without trample or other forms of evasion, that many beaters is still a formidable force.

Converts late-game outta-gas mode into endless wurm creation? Sign me up.
